1. Yes, in your Niyyah, you should mention 3 Witr Qadhaa. There is no Qadhaa for the Sunnats of Fajr.%0D%0A%0D%0A2. Salaat al-Dhuhaa is after Salaatul Ishraaq (which is about 10 or 15 minutes after sunrise). Salaat al-Dhuhaa will be after the sun has risen considerably. Its Niyyah should be the normal Niyyaah for any Nafl Salaat. (Tahtawi)%0D%0A%0D%0A3. It is undesirable to pull out grey hair.%0D%0A%0D%0A4. The Awrah of a woman in front of other woman is the same as the Awrah of a man (i.e. navel to knees) in front of other men and also including the stomach, chest and back. In front of Kaafir women, she should cover everything. (Hidaaya)%0D%0A%0D%0A5. Since you promised the first person something, you will have to fulfil it. It will not be permissible to go back on it. Instead, you should try and give both of them something.%0D%0A%0D%0A6. It is only Makrooh to sleep before Esha or after Asr Salaat if there is a fear of you missing it. However, since you are in menses you cannot read Esha and Asr Salaats, it will not be Makrooh. (Shaami)%0D%0A%0D%0A7. Refer 6 above.%0D%0A%0D%0A8. If you are sure the person is doing wrong and you fear for his Imaan, you should correct him. However, if you are not certain he is doing wrong, e.g. you see someone doing something which has two possibilities, good and bad, then in that case try and make good thoughts for him and give him the benefit of the doubt.%0D%0A%0D%0A9. She should make all attempts to delay going back until she becomes pure again. A woman in the state of Haydh may not enter any Musjid, let alone Musjidul-Haram. The Fuqahaa have mentioned that should a woman perform her Tawaaf-e-Ziyaarah in the state of Haydh, the Tawaaf is considered as valid, even though the woman is sinful in doing such a Tawaaf.
